Description: Painted wooden shabti of the singer of Amun Pairy with a black lappet-wig, a red modelled face with black and white eyes and parallel red hands holding two red hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a red yoke with two pendular nw-pots and a seed-basket; patches of varnish remain.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
